groups.desc: Workshops for anyone who wants to find ways of resolving conflict without resorting to violence. Low cost places available.

groups.type: Anxiety (including OCD, Phobias, Panic, Social Anxiety)
groups.desc: Information and support for people with anxiety disorders including 1:1 therapy info.

groups.type: Anxiety (including OCD, Phobias, Panic, Social Anxiety)
groups.desc: Benzodiazepine mutual support forum and information for those withdrawing and recovering from benzodiazepine use.

groups.type: Anxiety (including OCD, Phobias, Panic, Social Anxiety)
groups.desc: Information for sufferers and carers of people with Panic, Anxiety, Phobias and OCD, including Message Forum and Chat room.

groups.type: Anxiety (including OCD, Phobias, Panic, Social Anxiety)
groups.desc: Information, advice & telephone mentoring for people (and carers) with Panic, Anxiety, Phobias, OCD and the effects of tranquiliser withdrawal. Plusaudio and phone (01952 680835) recording of the Breathing Technique.

groups.type: Anxiety (including OCD, Phobias, Panic, Social Anxiety)
groups.desc: Information and advice for people affected by OCD (and their family/friends), including advice line, blogs, publications, advice on seeking therapy and support group information.

groups.type: Anxiety (including OCD, Phobias, Panic, Social Anxiety)
groups.desc: Support, information and advocacy to anyone affected by OCD, including local and online support groups.

groups.type: Anxiety (including OCD, Phobias, Panic, Social Anxiety)
groups.desc: Volunteer led forum and chat rooms for those with social anxiety.

groups.type: Anxiety (including OCD, Phobias, Panic, Social Anxiety)
groups.desc: Information and network of self-help groups for people with phobias, OCD and other related anxiety difficulties.
Helpline for anyone affected by the death of a child of any age. Advice, information, listening, befriending, referrals and face to face service by arrangement.
Helpline and support services for bereaved parents, siblings and grandparents after the death of a child of any age and any cause.
One to one, group and email support for people at any time along the bereavement journey - however, wherever and whenever your loved one died.
Helpline and other support services run by a self-help group for people bereaved by suicide. Monthly group meetings in various locations.
Information, on-line community, Peer Support line and a network of self help groups for people affected by bipolar disorder.
Part of Family Lives Project, providing forums, advice and information about staying safe and how to deal with cyber bullying.
Information for anyone being bullied at work plus support and discussion forum.

groups.link: Awareness Centre (Clapham, SW4 and Tooting, SW17)
groups.desc: Low cost counselling and psychotherapy via self-referral, £20 a session for those on benefits / £35 for those on a low income.
Accreditation organisation for counselling and psychotherapy, with national directory of counsellors on their website, some of who offer low cost therapy.
Low cost counselling service dealing with a range of problems with online self-referral. Fees on a sliding scale, with some free places.

groups.link: Guild of Psychotherapists Psychotherapy Clinic (London, SE1)
groups.desc: Low cost psychoanalytic psychotherapy service for people on income of less that £18,000, via self referral to reduced fee clinic.
CBT for anxiety (panic, social anxiety OCD etc) and depression and counselling for other difficulties. Self, online and GP referral – free NHS service.

groups.link: Multi Ethnic Service, Waterloo Community Counselling (London, SE1)
groups.desc: Free service for those that require counselling in other languages, and to refugees and asylum seekers living in any South London borough. Self-referral via Lambeth IAPT calling 020 3228 6747.
Low cost counselling service for a range of problems via self-referral. Fees on a sliding scale.
Individual CBT, psychodynamic, psychoanalytic and group therapy. Fees according to income bands (minimum £40 per session for long term therapy).
Support to mothers suffering from post-natal illness via phone and webchat.
Helpline, information and webchat for men at risk of suicide or wishing to talk.
Website and helpline supporting people under 35 at risk of suicide.
Information for people affected by complex Dissociative Identity Disorders (DID).
Helpline, information and support service, including Find a Therapist and peer support forum for people with DID.
Information, advice and refuge for South Asian women (age 18+) and their children experiencing domestic violence.

24 hour national domestic violence helpline, plus information and resources, run by Refuge and Women’s Aid for women experiencing domestic violence, their family, friends, colleagues and others calling on their behalf.
For male perpetrators, their female partners and children. A range of services including violence prevention group programme with fees on a sliding scale or free via Social Services.

Arange of support services for men who want to stop behaving violently or abusively, and for the people affected by their violence or abuse. These include a focused brief counselling programme, a partner support programme, providing information and advice on the telephone.
Support services for those living in the London borough of Lambeth who are experiencing gender-based violence (Women aged 13 and over, and men aged 16 or over).
Blog site with information, event details and resources about parent abuse (child to parent violence).
A confidential helpline and webchat for any man experiencing domestic violence and abuse from a partner (or ex-partner).
Refuges, independent advocacy, community outreach and culturally specific services
Helpline for anyone concerned about their own or someone else’s behaviour towards their partner (male, female, in heterosexual or same-sex relationships).
Advice, advocacy, counselling, children/young people and families service and refuges for women who have experienced domestic and sexual violence.
Advice, contacts and Survivors Forum.
12 step programme for anorexia and bulimia. London meetings and virtual meetings.
Care, emotional support and practical guidance for anyone affected by eating disorders, via helpline, befriending and family support.
Information, helpline and range of online support groups.
Information, including local support groups and helpline finder for anyone affected by someone else’s substance use.
12 step Fellowship peer support groups for anyone whose life is, or has been, affected by someone else’s drinking.
Advice, information and support for carers, including groups and online forum.
Helpline for any family member affected or bereaved by a loved one’s substance use.
Helpline, e-mail and online support for a range of family issues including parenting with an online parenting course. Plus support (helpline & leaflets) for prisoners and offenders families.
Support, advice, practical support and online forum for single parents.
Advice, support and information for grandparents and the wider family in children’s lives – especially when they take on the caring role in difficult family circumstances or have lost contact.

groups.link: NACOA (The National Association for the Children of Alcoholics)
groups.desc: Info, advice, support and message board for anyone affected by a parent’s drinking.
Info, advice, support, counselling and chatrooms for problem gamblers and their families.

groups.link: CNWL National Problem Gambling Clinic (London, SW6)
groups.desc: Specialist NHS clinic for problem gamblers, offering brief interventions, psychological interventions and aftercare, via self-referral for problem gamblers and their families.
12 step Fellowship for problem gambling, forum, live chat, meetings, support and advice.
Self-help organisation for the transgender community, their partners and families, including 24hr information line, online support group, magazine for members and social events.
Directory of support groups for trans and gender non-conforming individuals.
Information, support, advice, forum discussions and awareness raising for hoarders and their loved ones plus links to other support websites under ‘resources’ tab
Helpline, e-mail, advocacy, online and group support for those with hoarding problems.
Support for LGBT community, including counselling with sliding scale of fees, substance use (via Antidote) and domestic abuse plus support groups.
Counselling and psychotherapy project for individuals, couples and families, with a sliding scale of fees from £70 per session.
Independent therapy organisation working with gender and sexual diversity clients, includes a ‘Find a Therapist’ service online.
A movement of people committed to building a happier and more caring society, includes information, groups, Happy Cafes and online courses.
A supportive online community where you can be yourself, listen, share and be heard, run by MIND, the Mental Health Charity.
Free face to face support in SW1 for those who feel suicidal. Contact via website for appointment.

groups.link: Living Life to the Full – CBT Skills Self Help website
groups.desc: A CBT life skills course teaching key knowledge in how to tackle and respond to issues/demands that we meet in our everyday lives.
Lambeth ‘front door’ to community based support for people’s mental health and wellbeing.
Free respite centre with 4-5 night stay for those in suicidal crises.
Bromley, Lewisham & Greenwich Mind supports residents experiencing any kind of mental distress by providing information, advice, support including 1:1 psychotherapy and groups.
An interactive self-help book to learn and practise skills to manage symptoms of depression and anxiety.
Internet based self-help resourcedesigned to help think about emotional problems and work towards solving them.

Advice and information across a range of issues (eg. welfare, carers rights, criminal justice), services and groups for people experiencing all mental health difficulties and their family and friends.
Telephone to talk, round the clock,about whatever is getting to you.
Emotional support and information to anyone affected by mental health problems through helpline (4.30 to 10.30pm), email services and online Support Forum.

groups.link: SlaM 24 Hour Mental Health Support Line

groups.desc: Out-of-Hours Peer Support Service in Lambeth, providing crisis support over the phone or in person during the out of hours.
Free workshops and courses to support living a meaningful and satisfying life for people who use SLaM services and those who support them.

A confidential telephone helpline offering emotional support to any individual on any issue. The Helpline is primarily a preventative service and aims to support people before they reach the point of crisis. Particularly aimed at those who are socially isolated, vulnerable, at risk groups and victims of any form of abuse.
SLaM led web initiative to improve individual and community wellbeing with lots of tips and ideas in relation to: body, mind, spirit, people, place and planet.
12 step mutual aid groups for alcohol problems.
12 step mutual aid groups for cocaine problems.
12 step mutual aid for crystal meth problems.
12 step mutual aid groups for people with substance use and mental health problems.
12 step mutual aid groups for marijuana problems.
12 step mutual aid groups for drug problems
Meetings and online forum for people with addictive behaviours and family/friends service
Online community of women helping each other to live an alcohol free life. Create a profile for free or pay membership, around £3 a month to get full access to other resources online.
Information, advice, community forums, online and support worker service for anyone with a personality disorder, family and friends.
Helpline support for reproductive choice by providing services to prevent or end unwanted pregnancy with contraception or abortion. Puts people in contact with their nearest consultation centre.
Abortion, vasectomy and counselling services.
Information, online and group support for people affected by the loss of a baby in pregnancy.
Information and support in pregnancy, childbirth and early parenthood, plus support services in local area.
Provides low cost therapy (sliding scale from £10) for LGBT individuals and couples around relationships.
Provides couple and family therapy service for those who are finding relationships problematic. Sliding scale of fees.  Also family mediation service for couples who are separating or divorcing.
Relate offers advice, relationship counselling, sex therapy, workshops, mediation, consultations and support face-to-face, by phone and through this website.
Free guided mindfulness meditations to download and information about apps.
Website with information, resources, practices and research relating to self-compassion.
User led organisation providing information, alternative coping ideas, online support and forum for people affected by self-injury including family and friends.
24 hour online forum for people who self-injure, as well as their family and friends.
Information, advice and 24 hour online support community for people who self-harm.
Fact sheet, resources and online forums for people who self-harm.
List of national support groups, information and self-help ideas plus Women’s Self Injury Helpline 0808 800 8088 (not 24 hr) and text and email support 07537 432444 (not 24 hr)
A signposting service that provides free support, information and in house counselling to anyone regarding issues to do with childhood abuse, incest and sexual violence.

groups.phone: 020 3299 6900 for urgent advice/support if recently assaulted
groups.desc: For anyone who has been raped or sexually assaulted (women, men, children). Trained, experienced professionals give medical help and advice, counselling, practical emotional support, help with deciding whether to report crime to the Police, advice relating to pregnancy, sexually transmitted disease.
Support for all non-abusing parents and carers whose children have been sexually abused including helpline, advice and advocacy. Interpretation available.
National freephone support line for adults who have suffered any type of abuse in childhood. Plus local support group information and free legal advice.
Counselling (from £16 for those receiving benefits), advocacy, groups, workshops and self-care (useful resources on website) for men and women who have experienced childhood sexual abuse and trauma.
Comprehensive service for female survivors of sexual violence living anywhere in South London including 1:1 counselling (0208 683 3311) and group therapy (contribution as able).

1:1 web or SMS or WhatsApp chat and counselling for men who have been raped or sexually abused. Support for those who have (or are considering) reporting to the police for emotional support, health, legal process and safety advice.
Social networking site to help build friends around shared interests in your local area.
Special interest and support groups in London.
The Helpline provides practical advice and information to anyone who is currently or previously been affected by harassment or stalking.
Helpline, free treatment and support for Veterans with mental health difficulties and their families.
Support to Veterans who have PTSD and their families.
Information, support, understanding and forum for people who hear voices and those that support them, with a Find A Group service.
Free, confidential, independent, impartial advice (welfare benefits, housing, debt, consumer law, employment, utilities, general)by way of appointments, home visits and outreach.
Free service that helps people in financial need to access welfare benefits, charitable grants and other financial help – online, by phone and face to face.

Supporting women who are at risk of or have been touched by the criminal justice system. Safe space with holistic one to one and group support around housing, welfare, education, employment, finances, substance misuse, health, parenting, court, leaving prison, exiting prostitution and domestic abuse.
National residential college for women with free courses for those on benefits.
Low cost counselling service for young people age 11-25 for around £10 per session.

Information and support (Helpline and 1:2:1 Chat, group chat, counseling and Apps) across a range of issues: relationships, mental health, substance misuse, physical health, housing, money etc. for 13-25 year olds.
Youth health centre (for ages 13-20) where you can see a youth worker, counsellor or doctor to discuss any health concerns or worries in a safe and confidential space.
